analysis.analysis: The 'npc livestreams' trend refers to the phenomenon of people streaming themselves behaving like non-playable characters (NPCs) in video games. This could involve mimicking the repetitive, scripted actions and dialogue of NPC characters or portraying themselves as 'human NPCs' in real-life situations. The trend seems to be a playful exploration of the boundaries between human and artificial behavior, and a commentary on the perceived lack of individuality or agency in modern life.
analysis.meme: When your life is on auto-pilot, you might as well be an NPC.
